titlestmt.titleproper: Elizabeth R. Lippincott stamp collection of birds of the world 1929-2006
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Elizabeth R. Lippincott stamp collection of birds of the world

bioghist.p: Elizabeth Roberts Lippincott (1888-1979) was a Quaker genealogist from Moorestown, New Jersey.

scopecontent.p: Elizabeth R. Lippincott's two volumes of postage stamps, arranged according to Oliver Austin's classification in his Birds of the World, with reference, after 1974, to Dr. Ernest P. Edwards' coded listing. Each order has a description followed by family and species, each illustrated by chronological listing of postage stamps and a sample stamp. The volumes were assembled in the 1960s and 1970s; the collection also includes an envelope of canceled bird stamps from Bob Peck, 2006.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
